title: Experimental Education Design for Blasting Demolition Engineering Using Virtual Simulations in K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary engineering mechanics, mathematics (calculus, basic statistics), and fundamental theories of blasting engineering
context.additional_context: Targeting mid-level professionals with field experience, this educational environment focuses on virtual simulations to mitigate risks and high costs of actual blasting experiments.

learning_goals: Explain and apply conduction method selection and cutting design principles through virtual simulation platforms
Learners can calculate ultimate stress on cross-sections and apply strength conditions by utilizing concepts of tensile/compressive zones and the neutral axis in the inelastic region.
Learners can implement and optimize blast coefficient, blasthole parameters, and ignition network design processes in a simulated environment.

resources: Blasting Engineering Textbook and Reference Materials

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
